intro: Iryanthera megistocarpa, commonly known as the giant cupuaçu, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a large shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces large, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits resembling a cup. The fruit contains a single large seed surrounded by a thick, sweet pulp, which is rich in nutrients and used in various traditional and commercial applications. Its botanical features make it a unique and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
